clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Novel Antimicrobial Hand Towels
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Novel Antimicrobial Hand Towels

lead_sponsor.agency: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

clinical_study.source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

brief_summary.textblock: In March 2012, the investigators initiated a prospective, cluster-randomized, controlled field trial in Kisumu County, located in an area in western Kenya which has the highest under-five mortality rate in Kenya with 149 childhood deaths per 1,000 live births 9. The study was designed to evaluate the effectiveness of an antimicrobial hand towel (hereafter referred to as towel) in preventing diarrheal diseases, acute respiratory infections, self-reported fever, and skin infections in children <2 years old.

detailed_description.textblock: In March 2012, the investigators initiated a prospective, cluster-randomized, controlled field trial in Kisumu County, located in an area in western Kenya which has the highest under-five mortality rate in Kenya with 149 childhood deaths per 1,000 live births 9. The study was designed to evaluate the effectiveness of an antimicrobial hand towel (hereafter referred to as towel) in preventing diarrheal diseases, acute respiratory infections (ARIs), self-reported fever, and skin infections in children <2 years old.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with diarrheal disease
primary_outcome.description: The number of participants that experience 3 or more loose or watery stools

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with respiratory infections
Number of participants with a subjective fever
Number of participants with a skin infection

arm_group.description: Hand hygiene education and 4 antimicrobial hand towels

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Mother of a child <2 years old
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inaccessible enumeration area in the rainy season
- Multiple eligible children in a single compound
- Moved between census and round 1
